str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To tarry, continue, stay in a place. From dia and the base of tribos; to wear through, i.e. Remain.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Festus. Of Latin derivation; festal; Phestus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and the middle voice of tithemi; to set forth, i.e propound.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Of Latin origin; happy; Phelix, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and leipo; to leave down, i.e. Behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining.
One bound, a prisoner. From desmon; a captive.
